column1: The best way we could honor small businesses this year is by passing COVID relief that would help them survive this pandemic.   @senatemajldr stop playing games with people's lives and livelihoods.
This Small Business Saturday hop online to see if you can #ShopSmall and get the same great deals from the safety of your couch 👩🏻‍💻

While you're chowing down on some Thanksgiving leftovers today why not take a moment to #GetCovered by signing up for healthcare through ACA Open Enrollment?    Go to https://t.co/YFvaIQsuwW to explore your options.

It's not enough just to give thanks to our frontline workers today—we must ensure they have what they need to be safe and make ends meet. They need us to pass a comprehensive COVID relief bill and it's truly the least we could do to honor their service during this pandemic.

While Thanksgiving may look different this year there's still lots to celebrate. Aside from being thankful for my family and our health I'm thankful for our essential workers who keep our nation going and our troops who keep our country safe.   Happy Thanksgiving everyone.
Think about it this way—if all of us could commit to avoiding unsafe in-person gatherings over the next few months we could enjoy so many more in the future.

Every woman and every girl deserves to live a life free from violence. Today on International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women America can be a leader and honor survivors by expanding the Violence Against Women Act.

Instead of addressing the massive surge in COVID cases across the country the Senate GOP is... *checks notes* confirming a lame duck's judges and appointees.  It's an outrage. We swore an oath to serve our fellow citizens and right now Republicans aren't letting us do our jobs.

For months local governments have been working day in and day out to keep us safe from COVID.   Now that vaccines are on the horizon I'm urging Senate Republicans—support equitable distribution with robust funding.   It's what every American deserves. https://t.co/nx66ovYkAG

The Trump Administration’s reckless decision to hastily withdraw troops from Afghanistan could make it even more challenging to safely bring home American hostages like Illinoisan Mark Frerichs.  I’m asking @SASCMajority to hold an opening hearing ASAP. https://t.co/71LfMpMxNO

Donald Trump and Republicans might not want you to know this but you can still #GetCovered during ACA Open Enrollment until December 15th.   Don't miss your chance—check out your options at https://t.co/olWP6I6Fle.

By giving the Taliban exactly what it wants in exchange for nothing the Trump Admin could be extinguishing any hope that American hostages Mr. Overby and Mr. Frerichs—or any others—may have to see their families again.   Important points Rep. Moulton. (@teammoulton) ⬇️ https://t.co/AjHTPL72vy
Despite what it’s seemed like for the last 4 years President-elect Biden is sending a clear message that America is not for sale. https://t.co/ENAhC6KKsF
Find the latest CDC guidance here ⬇️ https://t.co/5LmwY2DUop

There's a light at the end of the tunnel with news that effective COVID vaccines might be on the way but we aren't out of the woods yet. Please help protect your loved ones and ensure our hospitals aren't overwhelmed during the holidays.  Wear a mask. Social distance.
With his cabinet picks Joe Biden is telling the rest of the world: America is back in business. https://t.co/sgendzZj6n

It absolutely should not have taken this long—but I know that President-elect Biden will be ready to handle the job on day one. And now that he and his team will have access to the people information and resources every Commander in Chief needs they can hit the ground running.

It's about time.   Each day a peaceful transition was delayed was a day lost in ensuring we could fight this pandemic plan for vaccine distribution reopen our economy and be prepared to counter the national security threats facing our nation. https://t.co/Ah2ZgDO2QH
You'd never be expected to eat your lunch in an airport bathroom—we shouldn't ask that of our kids either. https://t.co/R1nq17a3sG
There's a big difference between "want" and "need."   Donald Trump wants to have won the election. Americans need COVID relief.   See the difference?
Whether he acknowledges it or not in 60 days Trump will no longer reside at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue.

We don't leave Americans behind.  @SenatorDurbin and I are urging @realDonaldTrump @DeptofDefense and @SecPompeo to make sure that any negotiated settlement in Afghanistan does not overlook the need to first recover all American hostages like Mark. https://t.co/qlazuElf4U

Mark Frerichs an Illinoisan and Veteran was abducted in Kabul earlier this year. Donald Trump's hasty decision to withdraw troops from Afghanistan could extinguish any hope that the Frerichs family will ever see their loved one again.  This cannot happen.

“What’s the downside for humoring him for this little bit of time?” Donald Trump's enablers have asked.  Well his ongoing lies about his defeat pose so many threats to our national security I decided to write them all down in an op-ed in @TIME.  https://t.co/GnSIoJC1kV

For all the lives cut short because of transphobia bigotry and hate we take a moment of silence on this #TransDayOfRemembrance.  Everyone deserves to be who they are love who they want and live without fear.

Benjamin Franklin once said of America: "a republic if you can keep it."  It's time we all agree that the American experiment is bigger than one person or one party. We can choose to move forward as a nation or fall apart into our tribes. I choose the *United* States of America.

Joe Biden was elected decisively.   He will be sworn in as President on January 20th 2021. Trump’s continued attempts to overturn the will of the people are hurting the foundation of our democracy and our national security.

I'm urging—no begging—my Republican colleagues to finally say "enough." Enough of this nonsense.   The margins in battleground states including those run by Republicans are larger than Trump’s own margins were in 2016—which he describes as a “landslide.”

Make no mistake—what Trump and his team are doing all of the baseless attacks and conspiracy theories will have long-lasting tragic impacts on our country. They're sowing doubt in millions of Americans' minds that this wasn't a fair or secure election when we know it was.
It has been painful—downright unbearable—to watch this president and his enablers try to systematically tear down our democracy with falsehoods and unfounded illogical conspiracies.

Donald Trump’s refusal to begin the peaceful transition of power is unwarranted and may slow down vaccine distribution which could cost lives. President-elect Biden and his team need to be brought into the process immediately. There's not a minute to waste. Let's get to work.

.@SenateDems and I are making the call now—the @HHSGov and @CDCgov must identify storage gaps provide guidance and work with underserved communities so every American can get a vaccine.   https://t.co/uW9AslBb93

From day one of the #COVID19 pandemic frontline and healthcare workers went without enough PPE to take care of the rest of us.   All on Donald Trump’s watch.  Our nation can’t afford the same mismanagement when it comes to vaccine distribution. Americans deserve a plan.

Today I’m wearing purple to honor the 47000 lives claimed by pancreatic cancer this year—from Illinoisans to Congressman Lewis and RBG. On World Pancreatic Cancer Day let’s expand our research to bring about greater progress to improve patient outcomes and save lives. https://t.co/AJVEKAChpp
Raise your hand if you would take COVID relief over Senate Republicans' political games any day of the week 🙋🏻‍♀️

I'll say it over and over again until I grow hoarse—serving in the military was the greatest privilege of my life. I'm glad I got to share why with @farai last week. Hope you'll take the time to listen. https://t.co/r1dbzuM0ST

He reminded us that our nation was conceived in liberty and that all men are created equal.   While the road is long may we continue the work to move our nation closer to that more perfect union where every man—and woman—is equal regardless of the color of their skin.
On this day in 1863 Abraham Lincoln asked a divided nation to come together by remembering our core values in his Gettysburg Address:  A government of the people by the people and for the people.

Instead of prioritizing the health and well-being of Americans—not to mention the millions of small businesses who desperately need help right now—what are Republicans doing?  Confirming right-wing judges and letting Trump rant rave and spew falsehoods about an election he lost.
Our adversaries are watching us right now—and this Coward in Chief is sowing chaos when we most need stability and exposing his weakness to those who wish us harm. https://t.co/RwBix0Rznh

It's time to end the stigma around homelessness.   Before this pandemic even began 1.5 million children and youth were reported as experiencing homelessness—a record. And COVID is only making it worse.   This #NRPM please help share these resources so no child is left behind. https://t.co/VSybY5TbpG

COVID-19 cases are spiking across the country at alarming rates. So during ACA Open Enrollment make sure you and your family #GetCovered. Find out more at https://t.co/YFvaIQsuwW or call 1-800-318-2596 today.

Each day of this pandemic family caregivers go above and beyond to help their loved ones.  This National Family Caregivers Month take a moment to recognize these heroes for all their hard work and dedication. For treating the families they work for as their own. https://t.co/TKYx7TsYgp
Let's say it together: Birth control is basic healthcare. It helps put women in charge of their bodies their careers and their lives. #ThxBirthControl

Working mothers—especially low-income and women of color—will endure long-term repercussions from this crisis if we don't pass childcare paid family leave and COVID relief.   Our nation needs to start treating working moms like the superheroes they are. https://t.co/7pOLH2MxQR
Donald Trump’s erratic behavior puts our national security at risk. https://t.co/X2hnTa8QPi

Now more than ever Congress needs to pass a comprehensive COVID relief bill that provides robust funding for our nation’s public schools and higher education institutions so these selfless educators are not left behind.

He changed my life. And small acts of kindness like that are happening every single day during this pandemic.  By tutors teachers and school staff teaching kids at home.  By those risking their health on the front lines without a COVID-19 vaccine teaching kids in person.

“Aw kids I’m so sorry I kept you working here so late. Here’s $10 go to Taco Bell it’s 2 for 99 cents—get something to eat before you go home.”  As teenagers we didn't see it then. But I do now. With his teacher's salary he was feeding the poorest of us & helping us get by.

When I was in high school my family relied on food stamps. But sometimes those food stamps wouldn't last through the week.  Luckily for me sometimes my English teacher would keep a bunch of us after school—and after a while he’d reach into his own pockets and say:

I wouldn't be where I am today without my teachers.  This #AmericanEducationWeek and throughout COVID-19 I see that same selfless kindness in our educators social workers support staff and parents who are working overtime to help students navigate online learning.

Let's be clear—we all want our troops to be brought home safely. But we cannot sacrifice our long-term national security interests or regional stability for a reckless chaotic drawdown aimed more at meeting Donald Trump’s desired timeline than keeping Americans safe.

Any decision to withdraw our troops from Afghanistan must be carefully planned and safely executed—but Trump and his newly-installed unconfirmed lackeys at the Pentagon are undercutting our allies potentially dooming the peace process and putting our troops at greater risk. https://t.co/jxHONSW6eS
https://t.co/1HMRM1Rdnx

It's time our Armed Services respect Black servicemembers and all Black Americans by renaming the bases named after those who took up arms against the United States to keep their ancestors in chains.  Any efforts by Republicans to stop this are disgraceful.   #BlackLivesMatter

Historically our enemies have tested us within the first year of a new administration. And by forcing the Pentagon into his latest culture war Donald Trump is only endangering our national security that much more.  Tune into my @SenateDems announcement at 2:45 PM ET.
When my Republican colleagues refuse to wear a mask in the Capitol they’re putting all of us and our loved ones at risk.  Please just wear a mask. https://t.co/N1oYMAfsT2
COVID-19 is real. It doesn't care about red states or blue states and spreading disinformation does nothing to stop the spread. Please wear a mask. https://t.co/q42Mt8Tr7l

Wishing my dear friend and colleague Rep. Bustos a full and swift recovery. Get well soon. https://t.co/BuIS3PWldG

Illinoisans—we must reduce the spread of this virus.   For our economy. For our healthcare workers. For our teachers. For our children.   Please stay home as much as possible and stay safe. https://t.co/SeXatpQMD1

The one consolation is the professionalism and dedication to their oath of the Armed Services. Our troops will never let us down but they deserve better from their Commander in Chief.

My heart is so full seeing this barrier for Black women finally broken by one of our own from Lake Forest Illinois.   My warmest congratulations Midshipman Sydney Barber! Your team our military and Americans everywhere will benefit from your leadership. https://t.co/8Pac1gUlWp

Real leaders—effective leaders—don’t take chances that put not only our servicemembers at greater risk but potentially put our entire nation at greater risk as well.  Just to score some political points.

Too many recent administrations have faced major national security crises in their first 12 months—like the first World Trade Center bombing or 9/11. Every day of preparation for the next president counts and can make a big difference.  Without it the harm and risks are obvious.
And when Republicans say “Oh what’s the harm in humoring him for a few days...”  It really just sounds like they simply don’t understand the very real threats our nation faces.

Joe Biden will be our next president.   And the instability and lack of coordination from Donald Trump and his administration not only hurts President-elect Biden’s ability to prepare but it projects weakness to actors around the world who might want to take advantage.

Let's be clear—the upheaval at the @DeptofDefense is a threat to our national security.  On his way out the door Trump and his enablers seem determined to destabilize our military and put our country at risk.  All at a critical time of transition.

Absolutely heartbroken to see this.    My heart is with the families and loved ones of those brave servicemembers as we mourn this tragic loss. I’ll continue to monitor this developing story closely. https://t.co/KhBXpYoAdC

So in my current role serving no longer from the cockpit but the Senate I’m committed to using my voice to ensure our Armed Forces are the strongest they can be.    To me true patriotism will always be how we honor the sacrifices those in uniform have made for the rest of us.

My buddies thought I was dead. But they risked their own lives to bring my body back home to my family.   So from the moment I woke up in Walter Reed I vowed to find a way to repay my buddies who saved me as well as all those who've sacrificed so much to defend this nation.

I still remember the rain coming down that morning and the taste of my lunch that afternoon.   But most of all I remember the scorching heat and deafening roar of the RPG that shot my buddies and I out of the sky.

Today is my Alive Day the anniversary of the day I almost died but didn’t.    On this day 16 years ago an RPG tore through the cockpit of the Blackhawk I was co-piloting taking my legs and partial use of my right arm with it.

Let us never forget the sacrifices our Veterans have made to protect the freedoms we cherish. To every Veteran and their families: from the bottom of my heart—thank you for your service.   You are true heroes. You are my heroes. https://t.co/c57HakOFtb

This election was a testament to the strength and integrity of our nation’s democratic process and now is the moment for true leaders in the Republican Party to condemn any and all efforts to undermine confidence in the legitimacy of these results.

Sabal who served for 6 years and received an honorable discharge after attaining the rank of sergeant was tied up in the naturalization process for 25 years—deported in 2008 and refused entry to attend his own citizenship interview by the Trump Administration last year.
Some good news tonight—a thread.  After more than two decades today U.S. Marine Corps Veteran Roman Sabal was finally granted his citizenship.  I’m so proud to call him a fellow American.

I don’t get that during the day normally. It’s so nice to see my kids all day long. It’s lovely. But also frustrating. It's a lot of: “I love you. Kiss kiss kiss. Okay the conference call is starting.” Read more here in this piece about working parents: https://t.co/QBnDqJLqbw

But to be fair there are some amazing high points when working from home. Like when I get done with a conference call and I have 10 minutes before the next one and my 2-year-old comes up and she goes "Mommy!" and gives me a hug and a kiss.

My schedule in many ways is more demanding and more full now than it was before. Because before there was a real separation. I’d leave home and go to work and there’d be a work schedule. Now there’s no separation.

I recently spoke w/@washingtonpost about what my experience has been during quarantine as a working mom. Honestly I—like all parents—still worry and have self-doubt about whether I’m doing enough. Is my 5-year old going to be ready for kindergarten? Is that going to be my fault?

Right now moms are working harder than ever -- juggling work homeschooling parenting & more.   Today on #MothersDay let's remember that & give them all the love & appreciation those hardworking moms deserve.

“So what if he did” flies in the face of the concept that in America no one is above the law – especially not the President who is bound by the Constitution to faithfully execute the law. The President’s defense appears to be arguing that he actually is above the law.

Where does this end? Are there no limits? Does anyone truly believe this type of imperial lawless presidency is what our Framers envisioned? I’m troubled that Counsel for the President appears to be shifting from denying the allegations to arguing “So what if he did?”

This isn’t theoretical. Last October the President’s lawyer literally argued in federal court that the President could never be criminally investigated while in office. Even if he pulled out a handgun and shot someone on Fifth Avenue.

Are any of these actions truly outside the realm of possibilities when we have an occupant of the Oval Office who admires violent authoritarian leaders and has declared: "I have an Article 2 where I have the right to do whatever I want as president”?

The President could make a $25000 campaign donation to get a State Attorney General to stop investigating his business so long as HE believes this quid pro quo will help him get elected in the public interest.

The President could exercise his constitutional authority to grant a full pardon to any person convicted of the federal crime of hacking a political rival’s email so long as HE believes this quid pro quo will help him get elected in the public interest.

This extreme statement has no basis in the Constitution. It is chilling in its implications. Consider a few examples of the behavior – the “kind of quid pro quo” – that Donald Trump’s lawyers are asking the Senate to agree cannot result in impeachment:

🚨 Last evening President Trump’s attorney claimed: “And if a President does something which he believes will help him get elected in the public interest that cannot be the kind of quid pro quo that results in impeachment.”
